input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request. To execute multiple item, give multiple <item> element in the <items> element.
Update Interaction
This wrapper updates an interaction record. Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>update-interaction</operation-name> <model> <keys> <call-i-d> <value>Incident1005</value> <type>String</type> </call-i-d> </keys> <instance> <call-i-d> <value>Incident1005</value> <type>String</type> </call-i-d> <callback-contact> <value>PETERS, JEFF</value> <type>String</type> </callback-contact> <notify-by> <value>notify by</value> <type>String</type> </notify-by> <category> <value>telecoms</value> <type>String</type> </category> <subcategory> <value>fixed infrastructure</value> <type>String</type> </subcategory> <product-type> <value>fixed infrastructure</value> <type>String</type> </product-type> <problem-type> <value>none</value> <type>String</type> </problem-type> <assignment-group> <type>Array</type> <assignment-group> <element> <value>AUTO</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>AUTO</value> <type>String</type> </element> </assignment-group> </assignment-group> <initial-impact> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </initial-impact> <severity> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </severity> <description> <type>Array</type> <description> <element> <value>description line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>description line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </description> </description> <open-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </open-time> <update-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </update-time> <opened-by> <value>opened by</value> <type>String</type> </opened-by> <configuration-item> <value>AA</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <call-owner> <value>Call owner</value> <type>String</type> </call-owner> <status> <value>Status</value> <type>String</type> </status> <resolution> <type>Array</type> <resolution> <element> <value>resolution type line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>resolution type line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </resolution> </resolution> <caller-department> <value>caller deparment</value> <type>String</type> </caller-department> <caller-location> <value>caller location</value> <type>String</type> </caller-location> <close-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </close-time> <closed-by> <value>closed by</value> <type>String</type> </closed-by> <knowledge-candidate> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </knowledge-candidate> <SLAAgreement-i-d> <value>1</value> <type>Int</type> </SLAAgreement-i-d> <priority> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </priority> <service-contract> <value>1</value> <type>Int</type> </service-contract> <sysmodtime> <value>2008.12.28 03:01:26</value> <type>DateTime</type> </sysmodtime> <site-category> <value>site category</value> <type>String</type> </site-category> <total-loss-of-service> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </total-loss-of-service> <failed-entitlement> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </failed-entitlement> <contact-location> <value>contact location</value> <type>String</type> </contact-location> <cause-code> <value>cause code</value> <type>String</type> </cause-code> <resolution-code> <value>resolution code</value> <type>String</type> </resolution-code> <company> <value>company</value> <type>String</type> </company> <contact-name> <value>PETERS, JEFF</value> <type>String</type> </contact-name> <reported-by-contact> <value>PETERS, JEFF</value> <type>String</type> </reported-by-contact> <reported-by-different-contact> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </reported-by-different-contact> <reported-by-phone> <value>reported by phone</value> <type>String</type> </reported-by-phone> <reported-by-extension> <value>reported by extension</value> <type>String</type> </reported-by-extension> <reported-by-fax> <value>reported by fax</value> <type>String</type> </reported-by-fax> <contact-email> <value>contact email</value> <type>String</type> </contact-email> <location-full-name> <value>location full name</value> <type>String</type> </location-full-name> <contact-first-name> <value>contact first name</value> <type>String</type> </contact-first-name> <contact-last-name> <value>contact last name</value> <type>String</type> </contact-last-name> <contact-time-zone> <value>contact time zone</value> <type>String</type> </contact-time-zone> <entered-by-e-s-s> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </entered-by-e-s-s> <SLABreached> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </SLABreached> <next-s-l-a-breach> <value>2004.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </next-s-l-a-breach> <update> <type>Array</type> <update> <element> <value>update line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> </update> </update> <needed-by-time> <value>2004.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </needed-by-time> <approval-status> <value>approval status</value> <type>Status</type> </approval-status> <s-l-a-agreement-i-d> <value>1</value> <type>Int</type> </s-l-a-agreement-i-d> <s-l-a-breached> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </s-l-a-breached> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements’ Description:
Operation-name [Required]: Valid values: <operation-name>update-interaction</operation-name>
Call-i-d [Optional]: Valid values: any unique string. Default value: Ignored.
callback-contact [Required]: Valid values: any valid/existing contact name of contact record. For example, 0, 1, 123h565 etc. Default value: Ignored.
notify-by [Required]: Valid values: any string. However, in application, it's anum with following values- none, email, telephone & other. Default value: Ignored.
Incident-category [Required], subcategory [Required], product-type [Required], problem-type [Required]: All NON-MODIFIABLE. Default value: Ignored.
assignment-group [Required]: Valid values: It's an array type element with each element be any valid assignment group. For example- AUTO, CLIENT SECURITY etc. Default value: Ignored.
Initial-impact [Required]: Valid values: 1, 2, 3, 4. 1 > Enterprise, 2 > Site/Dept, 3 > Multiple User, 4 > User. Default value: Ignored.
Severity[Required]: Valid values: 1, 2, 3, 4. 1 > critical, 2 > high, 3 > average, 4 > low. Default value: Ignored.
Description [Required]: Valid values: It's an array type of element with each of its element of string type. Default value: Ignored.
open-time [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. The possible values are of “DateTime” format. Default value: Ignored.
update-time [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. The possible values are of “DateTime” format. Default value: Ignored.
Opened-by [Optional]: (NOT writable) It’s maintained by application itself. Possible values are of “String format”. Default value: Ignored.
configuration-item [Optional]: Valid values: Any string. Default value: Ignored.
call-owner [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. The possible values are of string type. Default value: Ignored.
status [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. Possible values: open-idle, open- linked etc. Default value: Ignored.
Resolution [Optional]: Valid values: It's an array type of element with each of its input of string type. Default value: Ignored.
caller-department [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
caller-location [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
close-time [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. The possible values are of “DateTime” format. Default value: Ignored.
Closed-by [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. Possible values are string type. Default value: Ignored.
knowledge-candidate [Optional]: Valid values: true, false. Default value: Ignored.
SLAAgreement-i-d [Optional]: (NOT writable.) It refers to element <s-l-a-agreement-i-d>. The type of this field is “Int.” Default value: Ignored. priority [Optional]: (NOT writable.) It refers to element <initial-impact>. The type of this field is “String.” Default value: Same as that of <initial-impact>.
Service-contract [Optional]: Valid values: any input of format “Int” (Integer.) Default value: Ignored.
sysmodtime [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. Possible values are of “String” format. Default value: Ignored.
site-category [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
total-loss-of-service [Optional]: Valid values: true, false. Default value: Ignored.
failed-entitlement [Optional]: Valid values: true, false. Default value: Ignored.
Contact-location [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
cause-code [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
resolution-code [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
company [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
contact-name [Optional]: Valid value: any string. Default value: Ignored.
reported-by-contact [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
reported-by-different-contact [Optional]: Valid value: true, false. Default value: Ignored.
Reported-by-phone [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
reported-by-extension [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
reported-by-fax [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
contact-email [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
location-full-name [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
contact-first-name [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
contact-last-name [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
contact-time-zone [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
entered-by-e-s-s [Optional]: Valid values: true, false. Default value: Ignored.
SLABreached [Optional]: (NOT writable) It's referring to element <s-l-a-breached>. Possible values are true or false. Default value: same value as that of element <s-l-a-breached>.
Next-s-l-a-breach [Optional]: Valid values: any input in “DateTime”. Default value: Ignored.
update [Optional]: Valid values: It's an array type element with each of its element of “String” type. Default value: Ignored.
needed-by-time [Optional]: Valid values: any input in date time format. Default value: Ignored.
approval-status [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: Ignored.
s-l-a-agreement-i-d [Optional]: Valid Values: : Any integer values. These integer values are mapped to string values in application. The list of these mappings is customizable, i.e., more entries can be added to/deleted from it.
In out-of-box setup following mappings are available:
155 -> ACME Bronze 156 -> ACME Gold 157 -> ACME Platinum 158 -> ACME Silver 159 -> DEFAULT Bronze 160 -> DEFAULT Gold 161 -> DEFAULT Platinum 162 -> DEFAULT Silver 104 -> GEN Bronze 102 -> GEN Gold 101 -> GEN Platinum 103 -> GEN Silver 154 -> PRGN Bronze 152 -> PRGN Gold 151 -> PRGN Platinum 153 -> PRGN Silver
Here, if '155' is provided as value in item xml, on the application the value of this field will be 'ACME Bronze'
Default Value: if user don't provide value to this tag, the corresponding field gets ignored, i.e., the field doesn't gets updated.
s-l-a-breached [Optional]: Valid values: true, false. Default value: Ignored.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <hp-service-center-request> <xsl:if test="string('${username}') != ''"> <username>${username}</username> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${password}') != ''"> <password>${password}</password> </xsl:if> <entity> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">servicedesk</xsl:text> </entity> <entity-type> <xsl:copy-of select="(//entity-type)[1]/text()" /> </entity-type> <request> <operation-name> <xsl:copy-of select="(//operation-name)[1]/text()" /> </operation-name> <xsl:for-each select="/items/item"> <parameters> <xsl:element name="${request element}"> <xsl:copy-of select="./model" /> </xsl:element> </parameters> </xsl:for-each> </request> </hp-service-center-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
Update Interaction
This wrapper updates an interaction record.
